meanings.definition: Existing or occurring at the same time
meanings.sent1: The two clocks showed synchronically the same hour.
meanings.sent2: The dancers moved synchronically to the music.
meanings.sent3: The synchronized swimmers performed synchronically, creating a beautiful display.
meanings.sent4: The cars on the highway moved synchronically, like a well-choreographed dance.
meanings.sent5: The birds chirped synchronically, creating a harmonious melody.

meanings.definition: In a way that considers language as it exists at a particular point in time, without regard to historical development

meanings.sent2: The teacher taught the students to understand language synchronically before delving into its history.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked about language synchronically, making the audience laugh at modern word usage.
meanings.sent4: The writer approached the novel synchronically, capturing the essence of contemporary language.
meanings.sent5: The researcher studied the language synchronically, uncovering new insights into its current form.
